articles.title: Congratulations to President of Laos
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Laos
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Saynasone on his reelection as President of Laos.
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries formed and steadily developed in the common struggle for independence against imperialism and for socialism would grow stronger in the future, Kim in the message sincerely wished him greater success in the work for the development of the country and the improvement of the standard of people's of living.

articles.title: Congratulations to Lao PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Lao PM
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Thongsing Thammavong on his appointment as prime minister of Laos.
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to expand and develop in the future, too, the message wished him success in his work for realizing the industrialization and modernization of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Lao Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Lao Foreign Minister
						
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun today sent a congratulatory message to Thongloun Sisoulith upon his reappointment as deputy Prime Minister and foreign minister of Laos.
					 Expressing belief that the solidarity and cooperation between the foreign ministries would get closer to steadily boost the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two ministries, the message wished him greater success in his work.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Delegation Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea led by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of its Central Committee, left here by train on Thursday to participate in the preparatory meeting for the 15th congress of the Women's International Democratic Federation to be held in El Salvador.

articles.title: Week of DPRK-Iran Friendship Observed
articles.content:
Week of DPRK-Iran Friendship Observed
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Iranian embassy here was held at DPRK-Iran Friendship Pyongyang Jungsin Secondary School on Thursday to observe the week of DPRK-Iran friendship.
					 Present on invitation were Ambassador Morteza Moradian and staff members of the Iranian embassy.
					
					 Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the DPRK-Iran Friendship Association, members of the association and teachers and students of the school.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, the participants went round various places of the school and enjoyed an art performance of students.
					
					 They talked to each other about the need to further develop the relations between the two countries, deepening friendship.

articles.title: Nigerian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Nigerian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Mordi Emmanuel, charge d'affaires ad interim, and staff members of the Nigerian embassy here visited the DPRK-Nigeria Friendship Chilgol Vegetable Farm in Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang on Thursday.
					 The guests were briefed on the history of the farm associated with the undying leadership exploits performed by the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They helped farmers in weeding a vegetable field.
					
					 During a break, they exchanged conversations with officials of the farm, deepening the friendship.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: DPRK Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group Performs in US
articles.content:
DPRK Taekwon-Do Demonstration Group Performs in US
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A Taekwon-do demonstration group of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee staged demonstration performances in Delaware State, the U.S., on June 14, winning a high acclaim of American citizens and Koreans in the U.S.
					 DPRK flags were seen hanging in the venues of the performances, which were packed to their capacity with Taekwon-Do fans and spectators who gathered to watch Korean Taekwon-Do.
					
					 After the national anthem of the DPRK was played, demonstration performances started.
					
					 The group staged 16 kinds of Taekwon-Do numbers including Taekwon-Do exercise for health to the tune of cheerful music. 
					
					 The spectators broke into enthusiastic cheers whenever Taekwon-Do numbers showing the resourcefulness and staunch spirit of the Korean nation and the might of orthodox martial art were presented one by one and dynamic movements were performed.
					
					 VOA in a special program said that the demonstration performances of difficult movements and numbers based on good themes were reminiscent of scenes from a film.
					
					 They evoked a lively response from among citizens of various strata and students of the U.S.
					
					 Prior to the demonstration performances, the spectators watched a video showing the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize.
					
					 Major media of China, the U.S., Japan and other countries gave wide publicity to the news of the demonstration performances of the Korean Taekwon-do demonstration group and its sojourn in the U.S.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Family of Zhang Weihua
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Family of Zhang Weihua
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, Thursday on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK Celebrated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Work at WPK Celebrated
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A meeting of workers and members of trade unions and a meeting of members of the women's union were separately held on Thursday on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Reporters and speakers said at the meetings that after proclaiming the modeling of the whole society on the Juche idea as the supreme programme of our party, Kim Jong Il considered the transforming of the whole party on the Juche idea as a fundamental issue of party building and developed the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 They recalled that through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and wise leadership Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into an ever-victorious iron-willed party and a true mother party imbued with the idea of Kim Il Sung and the membership of which is united close around him.
					
					 Noting that Kim Jong Il has developed the WPK into a guiding force of Songun revolution with Songun as an invincible treasured sword, they stressed that the army and the people of the DPRK have won one victory after another in the political and military confrontation with imperialism and made new successes in the revolution and construction. 
					
					 A poem dedicated to the anniversary was recited at the meeting of members of the women's union.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the WPK, officials concerned, officials of the trade unions and the women's union and working people.

articles.title: School Youth and Children Tour Revolutionary Sites in Mt. Paektu Area
articles.content:
School Youth and Children Tour Revolutionary Sites in Mt. Paektu Area
						
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- School youth and children from across the country made a study tour of the revolutionary sites and battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu from June 8 to 16 on the lapse of 55 years since General Secretary Kim Jong Il explored the course of study tour of the sites.
					 They laid floral baskets and flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung at the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo Memorial Tower, the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site, the shore of Lake Samji and the Chongbong Bivouac and the mosaic of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu erected in the Mt. Paektu secret camp before paying tribute to them.
					
					 They went round revolutionary historic sites including Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site, the Samjiyon Grand Monument and the shore of Lake Samji. They made the rounds of the area of Samjiyon Township which underwent radical changes.
					
					 They climbed Mt. Paektu, the sacred mountain of revolution, and visited Konchang, Pegae Hill, the Chongbong Bivouac, etc.
					
					During their tour they had diverse political and cultural events including a gathering to hear impressions of reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas read and a contest among ranks of marchers singing revolutionary songs in chorus.

articles.title: Presentation of Writings by Foreign Students in DPRK
articles.content:
Presentation of Writings by Foreign Students in DPRK
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- "We Sing of the Sun of Songun", a meeting for public presentation of writings by foreign students studying at Kim Il Sung University and Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club Thursday to mark the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 At the meeting which began with chorus of "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee", an immortal masterpiece, those foreign students spoke highly of the undying feats and personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man who has made the history of invincibility with the unique Songun politics.
					
					 The presented works included travel notes "Following up the footsteps of the brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu" and "Beautiful Pyongyang", impressions "Mangyongdae, sacred place of the sun", visitor's account "Torch of Juche lightening all over the world", essay "Korea in my heart" and occasional notes "Azalea". 
					
					 In their works Chinese students expressed their resolution to contribute to developing through generations the DPRK-China friendly relations provided by the revolutionaries of elder generation.
					
					 They also sang "Song of Mangyongdae", "General and Children" and other Korean songs with reverence for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: New Load Power Control System
articles.content:
New Load Power Control System
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A new load power control system has been introduced in cities and counties of the DPRK.
					 The rational system makes it possible to monitor and control consumed power in a scientific way.
					
					 It, accurate in measurement, works well even in unfavorable weather condition, keeping electric distribution equipment safe. 
					
					 Many areas and industrial establishments have already enjoyed a benefit from the new system, economizing in electric power.

articles.title: New Strains of Flowers Bred
articles.content:
New Strains of Flowers Bred
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floriculture Institute has bred many new strains of flowers suitable for the country's climatic and soil conditions.
					 The institute has also succeeded in propagating flowering plants by means of tissue culture.
					
					 In particular, it registered a big success in cultivating flowers through gene transfer.
					
					 It has laid foundations for growing varieties of flowers by making use of genes resistant to low temperature and plant lice.
					
					 The flowers bred by the institute add to the beauty of streets in Pyongyang and other areas.

articles.title: Pets' Tricks Enjoy Popularity in Pyongyang Zoo
articles.content:
Pets' Tricks Enjoy Popularity in Pyongyang Zoo
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The Central Zoo in Pyongyang is always crowded with people.
					 Pets are most popular among the animals. They display their talents, drawing many people. 
					
					 Their program begins with toy dogs' hurdle-overcoming.
					
					 They also mount their hobbies, accompanied by cheerful melodies.
					
					 The program includes monkeys' feat performance.
					
					 Their stunts enjoy a big hand. After performance they wave their hands to acknowledge the spectators' cheers.
					
					 The program is crowned with a skipping rope trick performed by dogs together with monkeys.

articles.title: Celebrated Boxing Coach
articles.content:
Celebrated Boxing Coach
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Ri Kwi Jung, 62, is a well-known boxing coach of the April 25 Sports Team.
					 Over the past three decades, he has trained a number of female boxers.
					
					 Yun Kum Ju, who won gold medals at the Asian and world women's boxing championships held in 2010, and Kim Hye Song and Pak Kyong Ok, who took the titles at the 2011 Asia Cup Women's Boxing Tournament, were all trained by him.
					
					 His daughter Ri Jong Hyang finished first twice at the world championships and thrice at the Asian championships and his nephew Ri Suk Yong won gold medals at the 3rd and 4th Asian women's boxing championships.
					
					 Ri Kwi Jung, born in Japan, came back to his homeland, the DPRK, and studied at a university before becoming a boxing coach in his twenties.

articles.title: Ryongyang Mine Takes on New Look
articles.content:
Ryongyang Mine Takes on New Look
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The 50-year-old Ryongyang Mine, a magnesite producer of the DPRK, has taken on a new look.
					 There are stopes on peaks of mountains belonging to the mine.
					
					 The mine has well-equipped dressing plants and pits. Mining has been put on a large basis in the Kumsan, Chongnyon and June 5 pits.
					
					 All the mining operations are controlled by computer in the Kumsan Pit.
					
					 The mine also has magnesia clinker and light burned magnesia production facilities.
					
					 The mine is boosting output to satisfy the steadily increasing demand for its products.

articles.title: Guidelines for Peace, Reunification of Korea
articles.content:
Guidelines for Peace, Reunification of Korea
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- June 15 marks the anniversary of a joint declaration adopted at a summit between the north and the south of Korea.
					 The historic declaration and the program for its implementation -- the October 4 declaration -- serve as guidelines for the reunification, peace and prosperity of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The June 15 declaration calls for solving the issue of the country's reunification in an independent way with concerted efforts of the Korean people.
					
					 The October 4 declaration reaffirms the spirit of national independence and calls on the north and the south to closely cooperate with each other for an end to hostile military relations between the two sides and for detente and peace of the peninsula.
					
					 In the October 4 declaration the two sides share the understanding of the need for terminating the existing armistice system and setting up a durable peace regime, and agree to cooperate with each other to this end. 
					
					Both sides also agree to turn the West Sea of Korea into pacific waters to prevent military conflicts and ensure a durable peace between the two sides.
					
					 All the Koreans in the north, south and overseas aspire after peace and reunification of the country.
					
					 It is only outside forces and the south Korean conservatives that seek confrontation and war on the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 If the north and the south faithfully implement peace proposals contained in the two declarations, the peace and security of the peninsula will surely be achieved.

articles.title: Korean-style Socialism Ensures Juche Character and National Identity--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Korean-style Socialism Ensures Juche Character and National Identity--Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Korean-style socialism is now shining as powerful and advantageous socialism under which the strong Juche character is ensured and the national identity is brought into full play, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Thursday.
					 The article goes on to say:
					
					 Korean-style socialism always emerges victorious with the independent revolutionary line and working method. Its victory is reliably guaranteed by the strong driving force, and this socialism makes it possible to successfully inherit and full display the excellent traditions, culture and soul and spirit of the nation.
					
					 Today the Party, army and people solve any problem arising in the revolution and construction their own way with their idea, faith, decision and will. They invariably keep the independent revolutionary line and working method, which were chosen by themselves and reflected the will of the army and people. Herein lies the essential feature of Korean socialism.
					
					 The single-minded unity and military strength serve as the basic guarantee for all victories of the DPRK in struggle against imperialism or socialist construction. 
					
					 The independent national economy, built in the protracted struggle under the leadership of the Party, has become a precious asset for building a thriving socialist nation of Juche.
					
					 The superior spirit and culture of the nation are now being brought into full play in the country. The cultural heritage associated with the nation's wisdom and talents is handed down through generations as a precious treasure of the country and nation and the Korean nation-first spirit prevails all over the country.
					
					Steadfast is the faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to dynamically advance to the last along the road of Juche paved by President Kim Il Sung, closely rallied as one in mind around General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Minister of Unification's Reckless Remarks Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Minister of Unification's Reckless Remarks Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Puppet Minister of Unification of south Korea Hyon In Thaek at a recent seminar heaped slanders and calumnies on the DPRK, talking about "reason" and "isolation". He went the lengths of impudently asserting that the north should "appear in the venue of responsible south-north dialogue" and should no longer keep itself away from the normal orbit of south-north relations".
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					 It is ridiculous for traitor Hyon In Thaek to pull up the DPRK this or that way, instead of making an apology to the nation for the crimes he has committed against it so far.
					
					It was Hyon who conceived "no nukes, opening and 3000 dollars", an anti-reunification policy of confrontation pursued by the Lee regime, before taking his present office, deteriorating the inter-Korean relations.
					
					  The "venue of responsible south-north dialogue" touted by him is nothing but a theater of north-south confrontation.
					
					 A little over three years of office of the Lee group failed to witness any dialogue for national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 The conservative group has abused the dialogue as a lever for covering up its anti-reunification intention while busying itself with a smear campaign against the DPRK.
					
					 Such sinister aim is lurking behind Hyon's loud-mouthed "responsible south-north dialogue." It was quite natural that the DPRK National Defence Commission declared it would not deal with the group of traitors any longer. 
					
					His desperate effort to shift the blame for the collapse of the inter-Korean relations onto others would bring him nowhere.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak Group's Hideous Criminal Acts Flayed
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak Group's Hideous Criminal Acts Flayed
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Senior officials of central organizations of the General Association of the Korean Residents in Japan issued statements on June 13 denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its hideous criminal acts.
					 Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, in his statement expressed his irrepressible resentment at the Lee group which committed such thrice-cursed crimes against the compatriots as defiling the socialist system in the DPRK and daring hurt the leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 The hideous provocation committed by traitor Lee Myung Bak is the height of treachery and anti-reunification crimes revealing his true colors as a hooligan who seeks indolence and power only, subservient to outside forces, while being utterly indifferent to the nation and reunification.
					
					 Kang Chu Ryon, chairperson of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, in a statement condemned Lee Myung Bak for staging saber-rattling for a war against the north, sticking to his confrontation stand with his call for "apology" and "dismantlement of nukes." He committed such hideous crime as hurting the leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 The statement warned the Lee group that he would come to know clearly what miserable fate he will face for his indelible crimes against the nation.
					
					 Jo Han Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Union of Korean Teachers and School Clerks in Japan, said in his statement that criminals should be severely punished and the group of traitors be sternly judged by the nation.
					
					 The Korean teachers and school clerks in Japan will turn out as one in the struggle to frustrate the Lee group's moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and mete out a stern judgment of history to it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Defending GIs' Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Defending GIs' Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea in a statement on June 13 denounced the puppet authorities for defending the criminal deeds of the U.S. forces.
					 It has been disclosed that the U.S. forces in south Korea seriously polluted environment, gravely threatening the people's life, but they behave arrogantly, refusing to apologize as they did with the case of killing two schoolgirls 9 years ago, the statement charged.
					
					 What is more problematic is the humiliating deed by the Lee Myung Bak "government", which has defended the U.S. forces and left the right to investigation into the case to the criminals, it pointed out.
					
					 Worse still, the authorities have avoided the probe into its truth, claiming that the investigation may be made later since the U.S. military base in Puphyong is returned soon, it noted.
					
					 All the people will turn out in the action to overthrow the sycophantic and humiliating Lee "government" and wrest apology and reparation for the U.S. forces' crimes, it stressed.

articles.title: Paper Disclosing US Forces' Environmental Pollution Opened to Public
articles.content:
Paper Disclosing US Forces' Environmental Pollution Opened to Public 
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A paper written by an officer of the U.S. forces on the pollution in the U.S. military bases in south Korea was opened to the public, bringing into bolder relief the truth about the environmental  pollution committed by the U.S. forces, south Korean KBS reported on June 13.
					 This paper was presented to the U.S. Air Force Academy by an officer of the U.S. forces present in south Korea in 1997.
					
					 It disclosed that carcinogen 98 times the allowed level was detected in the U.S. military base in Puphyong at that time and the scrapped batteries were buried in the U.S. military base in Waegwan.
					
					 Oil in the underground oil tank north of the U.S. air force base in Kunsan overflowed, polluting the environment around it. An investigation into this pollution in 1997 led to the confirmation of the fact that carcinogen 13 times the allowed level was contained in the underground water and this contaminated underground water, particular, slowly flowed into the irrigation canal around the base.
					
					 110 million liters of oil leaked from the U.S. air force base in Osan due to the explosion of the oil tank in 1986, polluting underground water. In 1996 the U.S. forces unit side there banned its troops from drinking underground water.
					
					 The paper also deals with the environmental pollution in U.S. military bases in Uijongbu, Tongduchon and Phyongthaek of Kyonggi Province, Chunchon of south Korean Kangwon Province and other places.
					
					 What matters is that the U.S. imperialist aggression forces have kept all this secret till now.
					
					 The disclosure of more facts about the U.S. forces' environmental pollution helps estimate enormous damage done to south Koreans living around their base.

articles.title: End to Humiliating Relations with US Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
End to Humiliating Relations with US Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on June 13 issued a commentary on the lapse of nine years since the merciless killing of two schoolgirls Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son by the U.S. imperialist aggression forces in south Korea.
					 The grudge of the two schoolgirls, who were driven over to death by the U.S. armored car, has not yet been worked off, the commentary said, adding: It is because of the unequal south Korea-U.S. "Status of Forces Agreement" which grants immunity to the GIs even though they killed south Koreans.
					
					 This humiliating agreement lays an obstacle in the way of properly making an elementary probe into the truth about the recently disclosed U.S. forces' burial of toxic materials, it charged.
					
					 It is disgrace that the "government" has no right to investigate crimes of the U.S. forces which killed its citizens and buried toxic materials in its territory, it deplored.
					
					 The commentary stressed that to put an end to the unequal and humiliating relations with the U.S. depends on the people.

articles.title: Anti-US Rally Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-US Rally Held in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A rally was held in Seoul, south Korea on June 12 to denounce the U.S. forces' murder of two schoolgirls Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son and environmental pollution.
					 Attending it were members of at least 150 civic and public organizations.
					
					 Speakers at the rally bitterly condemned the GIs for committing such hair-raising atrocity as driving an armored car over the two schoolgirls on the roadside, killing them nine years ago.
					
					 It has been recently disclosed that the U.S. forces buried defoliant and other toxic materials in south Korea without hesitation, greatly shocking the people, they noted.
					
					 After the murder of the two schoolgirls occurred, the U.S. forces arrogantly handled it under the pretext of the south Korea-U.S. SOFA and this time, too, they are undisguisedly blocking the probe into the truth about the environment pollution, the speakers charged.
					
					 They declared that the organizations would launch an all-people action to probe the truth about the U.S. forces' environment pollution with the start of the rally that day.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Successful Unofficial Visit to China Hailed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Successful Unofficial Visit to China Hailed in Different Countries
						
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given in Russia, a seminar took place in Pakistan and a reading session in Nigeria between June 7 and 9 to congratulate General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his successful unofficial visit to China.
					 Dmitri Kostenko, chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Jong Il's unofficial visit to China was a historic visit of weighty significance in developing the DPRK-China friendly relations on a higher stage, powerfully promoting socialist construction in the two countries and achieving peace, security and prosperity in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 Kim Jong Il frustrated the U.S. imperialists and their allied forces' moves to stifle the DPRK, the chairman noted.
					
					 The chairman of the Pakistan Association for Self-Reliance Studies and other speakers said that Kim Jong Il visited China even under the complicated situation, deepening the ever-lasting DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 While staying in China, he toured significant areas associated with unforgettable memories of the days when President Kim Il Sung waged the hard-fought anti-Japanese armed struggle, providing an occasion of a new turn in boosting the DPRK-China friendship, they noted. 
					
					 Igwanagu Nicholas, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimjongilism, said that his visit to China proved successful under the particular care and cordial hospitality of President Hu Jintao and the Chinese party and government. This was an important event which put the international position of the DPRK onto a higher stage, he added.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of His Work at WPK Observed in Iran and India
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of His Work at WPK Observed in Iran and India
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Iran and India carried special write-ups accompanied with photographs of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The Iranian paper Iran News on June 8 carried articles under the title "Warm Congratulations to HE Kim Jong Il, Great Leader of the Korean People".
					
					 The paper in an article entitled "Developing the Workers' Party of Korea into an Invincible Party" said that Kim Jong Il is an outstanding leader who has not only developed the WPK into an organizational and ideological entity united around one centre and based on a monolithic idea and will but knitted close all the members of the society around the party. 
					
					 It referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il has developed the WPK into a mass party which is deeply rooted among the popular masses and enjoys their absolute support and trust. 
					
					The paper in an article titled "Kim Jong Il and His Extraordinary Ideological and Theoretical Activities" says that the DPRK has turned into a socialist power, adding that this is attributable to his extraordinary ideological and theoretical activities and wise leadership. It edited photographs showing his works and a photo of the Tower of the Juche Idea. 
					
					 The Indian paper Science Technology and Education News on June 8 in its article titled "DPRK, Single-minded Unity and Kim Jong Il" noted that the DPRK is a country of single-minded unity in which the leader, the party and popular masses are firmly united as one.
					
					 Another Indian paper Krishna Aberta on June 7 edited articles referring to the fact that Kim Jong Il displayed his noble personality as a great successor to the socialist cause and a popular leader while working at the Central Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported by Thai and Pakistani Organizations
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported by Thai and Pakistani Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Thai and Pakistani organizations issued statements on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration. 
					 The Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association in its statement on June 9 said that the joint declaration is a program for reunification indicating the most correct principle, orientation and ways for solving the issue of national reunification. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					The publication of the joint declaration brought the Korean nation a brighter prospect of the reunification movement. 
					
					 The inter-Korean relations have been put into a collapse by the moves of the present south Korean conservative regime to scuttle the efforts to implement the joint declaration and scrap it at any cost, keen to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					
					 We fully support the Korean people in their efforts to implement the joint declaration, the statement noted. 
					
					 On the same day the Pakistan Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification said in its statement that the joint declaration indicated an ideological foundation and fundamental way for achieving national reconciliation, unity and reunification, stressing that as the aim of the declaration is to settle the issue of reunification by concerted efforts of the Korean nation free from foreign interference, all the Koreans in the north and the south and overseas should firmly preserve the declaration. 
					
					 Recalling that astonishing changes have taken place in the movement for Korea's reunification since the adoption of the declaration, the statement expressed belief that the Korean people would achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by frustrating the moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities against the DPRK.

articles.title: Austrians Back Statement of DPRK NDC Spokesman
articles.content:
Austrians Back Statement of DPRK NDC Spokesman
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- Austrian organizations fully supported the statement of a spokesman for the National Defence Commission of the DPRK that it would no longer deal with the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea hell-bent on the vicious confrontation moves.
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna in a statement on June 5 said that it cannot pardon the crimes committed by the south Korean authorities.
					
					 It further said:
					
					 They are shifting the blame for the Kwangju massacre on to the DPRK and committing ceaseless provocations and crimes against it.
					
					 The "Berlin proposal" advanced by them is evidently a provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has no need to make any "apology".
					
					 At the time when it is making sincere efforts for peace and security, the south Korean authorities are seeking to ignite a war.
					
					 We fully support all the steps taken by the DPRK government to defend the sovereignty of the country and ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Federal Leadership of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation in a statement on June 8 bitterly condemned the south Korean authorities for their persistent provocation moves against the DPRK.
					
					 We fully support the statement of a DPRK NDC spokesman, it said.

articles.title: Guinean Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung Formed
articles.content:
Guinean Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung Formed 
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The Guinean Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung was formed with due ceremony in Conakry, Guinea on June 8. 
					 Present there were officials and members of organizations for the study of the Juche idea and those of friendship and solidarity with the Korean people including the Guinean Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry and the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected as chairman of the committee. 
					
					 At the ceremony the committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events including a seminar on exploits of the President, a photo exhibition, a film show and a lecture during the period from June 8 to July 8.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet in Brazil
Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted the first part of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" on its Internet homepage on June 9.
					 His photograph was also posted on the homepage.
					
					 The work, published on June 19, Juche 84 (1995), clarifies the idea that priority should be given to the ideological work to successfully accomplish the socialist cause and the basic mission of this work is to model the whole society on the socialist idea.
					
					 It also stresses that the ideological work should be conducted in line with principles and method suited to the intrinsic requirements of socialism.

articles.title: Chinese FM Spokesman on China's Aid to Africa
articles.content:
Chinese FM Spokesman on China's Aid to Africa 
 Beijing, June 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of China at a press conference on June 14 referred to China's aid to African countries.
					 Commenting on U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's remarks on the cooperation between China and African countries, the spokesman hoped that the countries concerned would view the cooperation in an objective and fair manner.
					
					 The spokesman stressed that China has never imposed its assertion on African countries nor has it used its aid to Africa for meeting its political purpose in full respect of African countries' right to independently choose their path of development.

articles.title: Chinese Senior Official Calls for Maintaining Principal Line in Defense Building
articles.content:
Chinese Senior Official Calls for Maintaining Principal Line in Defense Building
						
 Beijing, June 15 (KCNA) -- Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China recently called for holding fast to the subject and principal line of national defence and army building.
					 He made this call while making a study tour of the Lanzhou battle area.
					
					 Guo stressed the need to pay deep attention to thoroughly implementing the important theory of President Hu Jintao on national defence and army building under the new situation and effectively fulfilling the historic mission of the Chinese army in conformity with the realistic conditions of the new century and new stage.

articles.title: Iran Produces Enriched Uranium
articles.content:
Iran Produces Enriched Uranium
 Tehran, June 15 (KCNA) -- Iran has so far turned out 50 odd kilograms of enriched uranium with purity of 20 percent, according to the Iranian permanent representative to the International Atomic Energy Agency on June 12.
					 The country will reportedly produce more enriched uranium in the future.

articles.title: Iran Test-fires New Missiles
articles.content:
Iran Test-fires New Missiles
						
 Tehran, June 14 (KCNA) -- Iran test-fired new-type missiles on June 12.
					 The successful test-firing reportedly made it possible to introduce those missiles into the country's air defense system.

articles.title: Museum for Red Army's Slogans Opens in China
articles.content:
Museum for Red Army's Slogans Opens in China
						
 Beijing, June 15 (KCNA) -- China's one-and-only museum for the red army's slogans opened in Yanling County, Hunan Province, on June 9.
					 The museum has many slogans that were written by the Red Army in the 1920s and 1930s.
					
					 Everyone is allowed to visit it free of charge.

articles.title: New Books Published in China
articles.content:
New Books Published in China
 Beijing, June 14 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Publishing House has recently brought out new books including "Synoptic History of Socialism" and "Synoptic History of Communist Party" on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					 The published books amount to 90 kinds in all.

articles.title: Director-General of IAEA Not Welcome in West
articles.content:
Director-General of IAEA Not Welcome in West 
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Wall Street Journal recently reported that there is a growing tendency of rejecting the director-general of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) among Western countries. 
					 The paper said that some Western countries are intentionally giving Amano, director-general of IAEA, short shrift at important international conferences, strongly displeased with his response to the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi power plant of Japan. 
					
					 The paper expressed concern over the fact that the director-general is still "under the influence of the Japanese government".

articles.title: US Persists in Anti-Cuba Policy
articles.content:
US Persists in Anti-Cuba Policy
						
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- The United States is persisting in the hostile policy toward Cuba despite the unanimous protest of the world community.
					 According to the Prensa Latina, the U.S. recently allotted 20 million dollars to intensify propaganda and economic sanctions against Cuba under the vicious purpose of destabilizing it.

articles.title: Cyber Attack on IMF
articles.content:
Cyber Attack on IMF
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- There was a cyber attack on the International Monetary Fund.
					 The New York Times on June 11 said in a report this was a large-scale and high level cyber attack, adding there is concern that it might adversely affect the international financial market in case there was the leakage of secret information.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits New Zealand
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits New Zealand
 Pyongyang, June 16 (KCNA) -- A 6-magnitude aftershock hit New Zealand's South Island city of Christchurch on Monday.
					 The quake occurred 10 km east of Christchurch.
					
					 It left ten persons wounded, several buildings pulled down or damaged and electricity supply to about 10,000 flats suspended.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia a Hyon In Thaek
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia a Hyon In Thaek
Pyongyang, 16 de junio (ATCC) -- El ministro títere de Reunificación del Sur de Corea, Hyon In Thaek, en un reciente seminario calumnió a la República Popular Democrática de Corea hablando de "juicio" y "aislamiento" diciendo que el Norte debe "aceptar el diálogo responsable Sur-Norte" y dejar de desviar por más tiempo de la "órbita normal de las relaciones Sur-Norte". 
					Calificándolo de conducta ridícula, el diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual difundido en su edición de este jueves, prosigue: 
					
					Hyon In Thaek es el inventor de la "desnuclearización, la apertura y 3 000 dólares", política conflictiva anti-reunificación del "poder" de Lee Myung Bak, y el autor del fracaso de las relaciones Norte-Sur. 
					
					El "responsable diálogo Sur-Norte" de que habla Hyon significa la confrontación entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					Durante más de 3 años después de la toma del poder de Lee, no se ha realizado ni una vez un diálogo favorable a la reconciliación, la unidad y la reunificación de la nación. 
					
					La camarilla de los conservadores surcoreanos ha venido abusando del diálogo como espacio para acusar a la RPDC y encubrir su malsana intención anti-reunificación. 
					
					Es por eso que el Comité  de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC declaró que no se tratará por más tiempo con la banda traidora.

articles.title: Actos en varios países para felicitar visita a China de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Actos en varios países para felicitar visita a China de Kim Jong Il 
						
Pyongyang, 16 de junio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugares del día 7 al 9 la conferencia en Rusia, el simposio en Pakistán y el cenáculo de lectura en Nigeria en felicitación de la visita extraoficial del Dirigente Kim Jong Il a la República Popular China (RPCh).
					Dmitri Kostenko, presidente de la Asociación Rusa para el Estudio de la Idea Juche, subrayó que la visita extraoficial a China del Dirigente reviste históricamente significación trascendental en desarrollar en nueva etapa las relaciones de amistad Corea-China, promover con más vigor la construcción socialista en los dos países y lograr la paz, la seguridad y la prosperidad de Noreste Asiático y el resto del mundo.
					
					Prosiguió que el Dirigente frustró las maquinaciones de aplastamiento de los imperialistas yanquis y sus fuerzas aliadas contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea (RPDC).
					
					El titular de la Asociación Pakistaní para el Estudio de Autoconfianza y otros oradores señalaron que el Dirigente realizó la visita a China y profundizó el sentimiento de invariable amistad Corea-China aún en medio de la complicada situación actual.
					
					Destacaron que durante su permanencia en China, el Dirigente hizo recorrido por las zonas significativas donde el Presidente Kim Il Sung dejó imborrables recuerdos en los días de la enconada lucha armada antijaponesa y preparó una oportunidad de nuevo viraje para consolidar la amistad Corea-China.
					
					Igwanagu Nicholas, titular del Grupo de Estudio del Kimjongilismo de Nigeria, recalcó que la visita a China de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il se realizó con éxito bajo la atención especial y la cordial hospitalidad del Presidente Hu Jintao, el partido y el gobierno de China y subrayó que esto fue un evento importante que llevó a una etapa mas alta la posición internacional de Corea.

articles.title: Representación modelo en EE.UU. de grupo coreano de Taekwondo
articles.content:
Representación modelo en EE.UU. de grupo coreano de Taekwondo
						
Pyongyang, 16 de junio (ATCC) -- El grupo de demostración de Taekwondo del Comité de  Taekwondo de Corea realizó el día 14 en el Estado de Delaware la  actuación modelo ganando efusivas ovaciones de ciudadanos estadounidenses y coreanos radicados en Estados 
					En los lugares de presentación estaba colgada la bandera de la República Popular Democrática de Corea. Los aficionados a este arte marcial y otras personas acudieron para ver Taekwondo de Corea.
					
					Tras la interpretación del himno nacional de la RPDC hubo la representación modelo de Taekwondo.
					
					Al son de las melodías ligeras los Taekwondocas demostraron 16 disciplinas, incluyendo el Taekwondo para la salud.
					
					Cada vez que cambiaban las disciplinas llenas de la inteligencia, el firme espíritu y el poderío de arte marcial ortodoxo de la nación coreana y mostraban los movimientos vigorosos de Taekwondo, los espectadores dieron calurosas exclamaciones.
					
					En su radioemisión especial VOA transmitió que la representación modelo con los movimientos difíciles y contenidos bien ordenados parecía presenciar las  imágenes de las películas.
					
					La representación modelo produjo grandes repercusiones entre los ciudadanos de diversos estratos y  estudiantes de EE.UU.
					
					Antes de presenciar la representación, los espectadores vieron el documental coreano "Arirang", función gimnástico-artística masiva laureada con el Premio Kim Il Sung.
					
					Las principales prensas y publicaciones de China, Estados Unidos, Japón y otros países dieron a conocer ampliamente la representación modelo de los Taekwondocas coreanos y de su permanencia en EEE.UU.

articles.title: Jóvenes y escolares recorren lugares históricos del monte Paektu
articles.content:
Jóvenes y escolares recorren lugares históricos del monte Paektu
						
Pyongyang, 16 de junio (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 55º aniversario del recorrido del Dirigente         Kim Jong Il por los campos de batalla revolucionaria de la zona del monte Paektu, los jóvenes y niños escolares de todo el país visitaron del día 8 al 16 los lugares de interés histórico-revolucionario y los campos de batalla revolucionaria en la zona del monte Paektu. 
					Los visitantes depositaron cestos y ramitas de flores ante las estatuas de bronce del Presidente  Kim Il Sung erguidas en el Monumento a la Victoria de la Batalla de Pochonbo, el lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Pochonbo, la orilla del Lago Samji y el vivaque de Chongbong, y ante el mural mosaico de las imágenes de los Grandes Hombres sin iguales en el campamento secreto del monte Paektu, y les rindieron homenaje. 
					
					Visitaron el lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Pochonbo, el Conjunto Monumental de Samjiyon y objetos de interés histórico-revolucionario en la orilla del Lago Samji y recorrieron la zona de la renovada cabeza distrital de Samjiyon.
					
					Además, subieron al Paektu, sagrado monte de la Revolución Coreana, y visitaron los vivaques de Konchang,  Pegaebong, Chongbong, etc.
					
					Durante el recorrido, los peregrinantes realizaron diversas actividades políticas y culturales como la presentación de estudio de las reminiscencias de los ex guerrilleros antijaponeses, el concurso de coro de canciones revolucionarias, etc.
